info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:07PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Catawba, southwestern Alexander, north central Lincoln, southeastern Caldwell and southeastern Burke Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 307 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hickory. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Newton, Lincolnton, St. Stephens, Conover, Longview, Bethlehem, Maiden, Icard and Hildebran. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
